area_name: Morgan's Knob Boulders (FKA Diving Board Boulders)

content.description: Sit in plethora of pockets make move to sloper rail and finish through jugs

This problem climbs up the arete, left of poo in the pool. Stand start, left hand on undercling jug, right hand on undercling ledge/pinch. Climbs straight up the arete topping out directly over the arete.
content.location: To find this boulder and this area in general follow these directions. Park at Morgan trail parking lot. Follow the blue trail which is Morgan trail, you will pass the trail entrance to Morgan loop trail, and a sign that is marked “V” keep going on the blue trail straight forward. You will then hit a map sign that is marked “W” here you will go left onto the bridle trail (this is the horse trail marked by white diamonds on the trees.) follow the bridle trail and it will bring you to the lake, keep following the trail with the lake on your left. You will pass boulders on your right side that will need cleaning but keep going and look down the hill on your left you will see the tall “Captain” boulder first. To hit Pool Party keep on bridle trail and you will see the boulder directly off the trail on your right.

content.description: Sit start on the dagger-like jug 5 feet right of Crown Jewel. Climb straight up on crimps.
content.location: On the same boulder as Crown Jewel, which lies directly uphill from the Captain boulder

content.description: On the second "tier" of sorts there are 3 or 4 in-place, attractive boulders that upon closer inspection lack any obvious lines. This problem is on the right side of the steep wall that lacks holds besides a few honkin' jugs. Anyway, this fun problem begins on low flat jugs, moves up and right to a circular pinch hold, then to a solid iron crimp rail and a fun mantle.
This easy highball follows the swath of pockets up the right side of the tall and attractive face that is central to the Diving Board Boulders.
content.protection: A few pads and attentive spotters
content.location: The right most line on the largest, triangular boulder central to the area the “Captain” boulder

content.description: This problem sits atop the hill, and commands the area like the center jewel on the crown of a king. Sit start with a tooth-like pinch and work into a undercling dish. Another strenuous move to a crimp followed by a committing bump and core intensive footwork eventually leads to easier ground.
content.location: This boulder is atop the hill, directly uphill (roughly North East) of the Captain boulder it may take some poking around to find it the first time. It has a nose-like profile if you approach it from the shoreline.

content.description: Sit low under roof and climb up on edges to slabby finish
Stand start on really dirty slab with really good and delicate moves
content.location: Past the Captain Boulder near end of boulderfield

content.description: Sit start on pockets and make move to sloper and go to top right of big pockets

pathTokens: Morgan's Knob Boulders (FKA Diving Board Boulders)

content.description: Another shoreline area with several established lines and lots of potential. Morgan’s Knob is more spread out than the nearby Pine Crest trail aka Lakeside Boulders. This area offers some great easy highballs and more mellow, moderate face climbing.
